page.description: Some character functions and a brief description on how to use them.

step.description: Create a new A5W page with the following content.
step.example:
<%a5 dim ultext as C = "Four score and seven years ago" dim extraspaces as C = " Four score " dim allcaps as C = "SEVEN YEARS AGO" %> More Character Functions

Some more useful character functions

<%a5 ? "ATC()returns the position of 'seven' in " + QUOTE(ultext) + ", which is " + ATC("seven", ultext) + "

" ? "CHR()returns the character corresponding to a value. For example CHR(66) returns " + CHR(66) + "

" ? "LEN()returns the length of " + QUOTE(ultext) + ", which is " + LEN(ultext) + "

" ? "OCCURS()returns the number of times one string occurs in another. For example OCCURS(\"o\", ultext) returns " + OCCURS("o", ultext) + "

" ? "STRITRAN()replaces characters. For example STRITRAN(ultext, \"o\", \"X\") returns " + STRITRAN(ultext, "o", "X") + "

" ? "STR()converts a number to a string. For example STR(345.67,5,1) returns " + STR(345.67,5,1) + "

" ? "SUBSTR()extracts one string from another. For example SUBSTR(ultext,6,5) returns " + SUBSTR(ultext,6,5) + "

" ? "VAL()converts a string to a number. For example VAL(\"34 cows\") returns " + VAL("34 cows") + "

" ? "WORD()extracts the Nth word from a string. For example WORD(\"chickens;ducks;geese\",2,\";\") returns " + WORD("chickens;ducks;geese",2,";") + "

" %>

Check out Character Functions for more information.

case.description: You can use the escape sequence \" to insert a quotation mark as a character, instead of as a formatting character.
You can embed functions within functions,as in QUOTE(UPPER(ultext)).
Alpha Anywhere has more than 130 character manipulation functions that can do anything with text.

step.description: Click File > Save As to save your page as "More Character Functions".
Click the 'lightning' icon to run the page in Live Preview. The result should look like this.

case.title: ATC()
case.description: Returns the position of a string within another string.

case.title: CHR()
case.description: Returns the ASCII character corresponding to an integer.

case.title: LEN()
case.description: Returns the length of a character string.

case.title: OCCURS()
case.description: Returns the number of times one string appears in another string.

case.title: STR()
case.description: Converts a number to a string.

case.title: VAL()
case.description: Converts a string to a number, where possible.

case.title: WORD()
case.description: Extracts the Nth word from a string.
